content.description: Smear and mantle through the more difficult blank section into chickenheads, then breath the free air.
content.location: starting at Sahara Motel head left (north) 150ft staying at the same height on the valley's side.GPS: 31.906432, -110.033563

climbs.name: Sauriform
climbs.fa: ?? so obvious that someone has surely climbed it before

content.description:
Climb the sea of perfect plates to easy topout and walk off.

 Simple but fun V-Easy on excellent rock.
content.location: When looking at Semi-Sweet, this boulder is the obvious plated rock left and behind Semi Sweet. Look at photos for location

content.description:
This one doesn't appear to be a highball from the ground, but the moves to establish on the dragon-scale slab are committing.

 Climb up the dihedral slab using smears, mantles, and side pulls, to a couple committing moves, then victory lap the solid patina scales to your heart's content. Punt off the crux and pad sled down the hill for full value
content.location: Start on the left hand sloper and crimp with bad feet. GPS: 31.905675, -110.033159

content.description:
Stand start with hands matched on the plate. Gain a right hand gaston and stand up into the underclings. Traverse left using underclings and a high hand hold on a flake. Work your feet over and mantle press to the left to top out.

 Harder than it looks. The rock was generally pretty good, once it sees some traffic and is really cleaned up this should be a great little problem.
content.location: From Semi-Sweet, walk left about 20 feet into a corridor with a tree. Bar Fight should be on the right side of the corridor, just past the small tree.

content.description: good highballs with patina'd exits. Early morning and late afternoon shade
